concept.title: Bat sonar
concept.shortdesc: Learn how bats find their way in the dark!

conbody.p: Bats locate their food and other things by a series of high-pitched squeaks from their mouth. They have extremely sensitive hearing. They can time their squeaks and the echo returning to their ears, to accurately measure the distance to their prey.
They also use this echo-location to avoid hitting the walls, floors, or ceilings of a pitch-dark cave!
While bats have poor eyesight, the Many Eyes accessory gives them night-vision capabilities.
